<gmd:DQ_Scope>                <gmd:level>                   <gmd:MD_ScopeCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode"                                     codeListValue="dataset">dataset</gmd:MD_ScopeCode>                </gmd:level>             </gmd:DQ_Scope>          </gmd:scope>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The near-time data from the USM3m01 buoy can be accessed viathe website at http://www.cengoos.org. The station data isupdated every half hour. Various data displays, includingwind vectors for one week, air and sea surface temperatures for one week, near surface salinity for one week and relativehumidity for one week are also available for download from the website. For further details on data availability and access, please contact CenGOOS program data manager.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The near-time data from the USM3m01 buoy can be accessed viathe website at http://www.cengoos.org. The station data isupdated every half hour. Various data displays, includingwind vectors for one week, air and sea surface temperatures for one week, near surface salinity for one week and relativehumidity for one week are also available for download from the website. For further details on data availability and access, please contact CenGOOS program data manager.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                <gmd:measureDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Salinity Bottle Data - Salinometer Comparison</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:measureDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:lineage>             <gmd:LI_Lineage>                <gmd:processStep>                   <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                      <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>The data processing steps used by CenGOOS will be briefly outlined here. More details are available at the Department of Marine Science(DMS) at The University of Southern Mississippi (USM). The primary data telemetry system using a Qualcomm Globalstar modem. The buoy calls a data server at USM/DMS every three hours to uploadthe half-hourly data. If necessary, the buoy can be set totemporarily dial in every half-hour. Service ARGOS is used as a back-up telemetry system. The USM/DMS data server uses Perl scripts to: 1)load the data into a database that is accessible to the CenGOOS webserver; 2) ftp's the data to the Geophysical and EnvironmentalResearch Group (GREG) at Texas A"&"M; and 3) ftp's the data to the NOAA/National Data Buoy Center. The data from the CenGOOS webserver isavailable at http://www.cengoos.org. The most recent observations,plots of data from the past five days, and access to the data archives are available at that web site.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>                      <gmd:dateTime gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                </gmd:processStep>             </gmd:LI_Lineage>          </gmd:lineage>
